message.content: {"id": "118780", "title": "Set alias for columns does not reflect in expression builder when selecting the dataset", "description": "When setting an alias for a column in a dataset, the expression builder still displays the old column name when selecting the dataset.", "OB": "After setting an alias for a column in a dataset, the expression builder should reflect the updated alias instead of displaying the old column name.", "EB": "Even after setting an alias for a column in a dataset, the expression builder still displays the original column name when selecting the dataset.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new datasource and a dataset. 2. Set an alias for a column in the dataset, e.g., 'column1'. 3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset. 4. Open the expression builder and select the dataset - observe that the original column name is displayed instead of the alias."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:

Description:Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old columns name when select the dataset.Steps to reproduce:1. New a datasource and a dataset2. Set alias of the first column in the dataset to "column1".3. Insert a data item and bind it to dataset.4. '}
